caption_original:
If you're catching a flight, don’t move too slow!  Know your airline's check-in time before you go. 

Did you know?
Airlines have deadlines for checking in, dropping off your bags and arriving at the boarding gate. The deadlines can vary depending on the airline – and whether your flight is domestic or international. If you miss a deadline, the airline may cancel your reservation > http://ow.ly/l4sh307jjQa
caption_cleaned: If you're catching a flight, don’t move too slow! Know your airline's check-in time before you go. Did you know? Airlines have deadlines for checking in, dropping off your bags and arriving at the boarding gate. The deadlines can vary depending on the airline – and whether your flight is domestic or international. If you miss a deadline, the airline may cancel your reservation >

caption_original:
DYK? Different kinds of coasting trade licence applications require different minimum advance notice time periods. Coasting trade applications must be filed at least 30 days before the activity starts, and, at least, 8 days for applications related to oil tanker operations. More information available >
http://ow.ly/PlF1309I7R1

caption_original:
Before you get into full vacation mode…
Make sure the airline has your current contact information (email address or phone numbers) so that you can be easily contacted if your flight is delayed, advanced or cancelled. Be sure to check your flight status 24 hours before your flight and then again before leaving for the airport > http://ow.ly/Qud8307jhxE

caption_original: Did you know? Our definition of a disability is a health-related problem that limits someone's ability to travel or causes difficulties while travelling. This includes temporary conditions like a broken leg. For more information about accessibility complaints visit > http://ow.ly/z2c7309MuAA

caption_original:
Each airline has its own terms and conditions in a document called a "tariff".  A tariff is a contract that outlines the rights and responsibilities of both the airline and the passenger. 

To read your airline's tariff, you can visit their ticket counter or go to their website.  You can also find a list of links to airline tariffs on our website: http://ow.ly/dwON307gDOY

As an air traveller, knowing your rights and responsibilities can help you avoid complications and issues during your trip.  http://ow.ly/qtHe307iTe7
caption_cleaned: Each airline has its own terms and conditions in a document called a "tariff". A tariff is a contract that outlines the rights and responsibilities of both the airline and the passenger. To read your airline's tariff, you can visit their ticket counter or go to their website. You can also find a list of links to airline tariffs on our website: As an air traveller, knowing your rights and responsibilities can help you avoid complications and issues during your trip.

caption_original:
Not a light traveller?
Did you know? There is no standard rule among airlines about the number of pieces, size or weight of baggage.  
These amounts are set by each airline, so it is best to check what your airline's rules are in advance.  
If any of your carry-on or checked baggage exceeds the amounts specified by your airline, you may be required to pay excess baggage charges.
Visit our Fly Smart page to find out more about how to prepare for your travels > http://ow.ly/X7GN307iUcj
caption_cleaned: Not a light traveller? Did you know? There is no standard rule among airlines about the number of pieces, size or weight of baggage. These amounts are set by each airline, so it is best to check what your airline's rules are in advance. If any of your carry-on or checked baggage exceeds the amounts specified by your airline, you may be required to pay excess baggage charges. Visit our Fly Smart page to find out more about how to prepare for your travels >

caption_original:
Did you know?
We work with carriers and terminal operators to ensure that accessible travel measures are put into action and maintained within the federal transportation network.
We have made a set of videos called "Accessibility for All". These videos are educational tools to help transportation personnel in providing accessible services to persons with disabilities.  
There are six videos that range in topics from recognizing needs to providing replacement mobility aids to travellers > http://ow.ly/Mf8A307vcVX

There are six videos that range in topics from recognizing needs to providing replacement mobility aids to travellers >

caption_original:
Did you know?
If you are a passenger with a physical, sensory or cognitive disability, you are entitled to receive a personal safety briefing from a crew member before take-off.  
For more information about accessible travel, visit > http://ow.ly/w1Q3303kfOf

caption_original:
If you are planning a trip with an attendant, make sure to contact your airline as early as possible – typically at least 48 hours before departure.
  
You may also want to ask your airline about special fares that could be available for attendants and the conditions for these fares.
 
> http://ow.ly/NTrp307iGvT
caption_cleaned: If you are planning a trip with an attendant, make sure to contact your airline as early as possible – typically at least hours before departure. You may also want to ask your airline about special fares that could be available for attendants and the conditions for these fares. >

caption_original:
Did you know? 
 It's the Agency's responsibility to ensure that everyone enjoys the same access to travel. Since 1988, the Agency has had a mandate to protect the human right of persons with disabilities to an accessible travel experience.  If you have an accessibility-related travel complaint, we may be able to help. Watch our video to understand our accessibility complaints process. >   http://ow.ly/D83o301kiF0

Since , the Agency has had a mandate to protect the human right of persons with disabilities to an accessible travel eerience. If you have an accessibility-related travel complaint, we may be able to help. Watch our video to understand our accessibility complaints process. > 0

caption_original:
Are you frustrated by your recent air travel experience? 
 
We are experts at resolving air travel complaints for travel within, to and from Canada. The vast majority of these complaints are resolved quickly, easily and informally through facilitation or mediation.  For complex issues, we also offer a court-like process called adjudication, where a panel will make a decision based on the evidence presented > http://ow.ly/LhW0300khbn

The vast majority of these complaints are resolved quickly, easily and informally through facilitation or mediation. For complex issues, we also offer a court-like process called adjudication, where a panel will make a decision based on the evidence presented >

caption_original: We don’t just deal with air travel accessibility. We deal with a wide variety of accessibility complaints including those related to rail, ferry, and bus carriers that cross provincial borders. Even complaints related to rail and bus terminals and airports > http://ow.ly/z2c7309MuAA
